Administration.text:
Type:
ACE inhibitor
Dosage Forms: 5mg, 10mg, 20mg, 40mg
Routes of Administration: PO
Common Trade Names: Lotensin

Adult_Dosing.text: 2-80mg PO in one or two daily doses

Renal_Dosing.text:
Adult: GFR <30 or Cr >3: 5-40mg daily
Pediatric: not recommended if GFR <30

Hepatic_Dosing.text:
Adult: Not established
Pediatric: Not established

Renal_Dosing.text:
Adult: GFR <30 or Cr >3: 5-40mg daily
Pediatric: not recommended if GFR <30

Hepatic_Dosing.text:
Adult: Not established
Pediatric: Not established

Renal_Dosing.text:
Adult: GFR <30 or Cr >3: 5-40mg daily
Pediatric: not recommended if GFR <30

Hepatic_Dosing.text:
Adult: Not established
Pediatric: Not established

Renal_Dosing.text:
Adult: GFR <30 or Cr >3: 5-40mg daily
Pediatric: not recommended if GFR <30

Hepatic_Dosing.text:
Adult: Not established
Pediatric: Not established

Adult: Not established
Pediatric: Not established

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
Angioedema history
Concomitant aliskiren use in diabetic patients
Concomitant or recent (<36h) neprilysin inhibitors (e.g. sacubitril)

Serious.text:
Angioedema
, anaphylactoid reaction
SJS
Agranulocytosis
, [[neutropenia
Hepatic necrosis, increased LFTs
Renal impairment

Angioedema
, anaphylactoid reaction
SJS
Agranulocytosis
, [[neutropenia
Hepatic necrosis, increased LFTs
Renal impairment

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: Adult: 10-11h, pediatric: ~5h
Metabolism: hepatic
Excretion: renal, biliary

Mechanism_of_Action.text: ACE inhibitor: inhibits conversion of angiotensin I to angiotensin II, which decreases vasopressor activity and aldosterone activity
